intro: Glaucium trivalve, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and wastelands. Glaucium trivalve is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
